metadata.name: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell - PS Script
metadata.comment: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND ((contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('get-wmiobject')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('gwmi')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('get-ciminstance')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('gcim'))) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('win32_shadowcopy')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('.delete()')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('remove-wmiobject')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('rwmi')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('remove-ciminstance')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('rcim'))))

output.summary: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil
